articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Studied Worldwide
Posters for Kimilsungia Festival Published in DPRK
U.S.-led War Exercises Flailed
articles.content:
Posters for Kimilsungia Festival Published in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Posters for the 8th Kimilsungia Festival to be held here on the occasion of the Day of the Sun were published.
 Printed on the upper part of the posters are letters "Commemoration of the Day of the Sun" and on their lower part letters "The 8th Kimilsungia Festival".
 Among them is a poster depicting the old home of President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae and Kimilsungias in full bloom. It well shows that the birth of Kim Il Sung was a glory of Korea and his august name is shining with Songun Korea dynamically advancing under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
 There is also a poster carrying Mangyong Hill in the morning glow of April, Kimilsungias in full bloom and a festival emblem.

articles.title: C.C. of 15th-Term South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Meets
articles.content:
U.S.-led War Exercises Flailed 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The frantic "RSOI" and "Foal Eagle" joint military exercises in south Korea and the joint military exercise between the U.S. and Japan before them were dangerous war games aimed at an actual war in the region. Especially, the aggressive nature and danger of the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises have been brought into a bolder relief as they were staged in the wake of the announcement of the "national security strategy report" in which the U.S. has defined a preemptive attack on the DPRK as its main military doctrine.
 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a signed commentary.    
 It is the U.S. main military strategy after the end of the Cold War to contain the DPRK with preemptive nuclear attack and then seize the military supremacy over Asia by expanding it, the commentary points out, and says:    
 The U.S. is now realigning and relocating its forces in south Korea, Japan and other parts of the Asia-Pacific region as a whole while intensively deploying the nuclear forces in the region. It is needless to say that such deployment of forces and escalated war drills are designed to attack not only the DPRK but also its neighboring countries.
 Today, the U.S. bellicose forces have fixed the nuclear war as the key mode of war for their supremacy. To this end, the U.S. is making ceaseless nuclear tests and stepping up the production of new types of nukes. It has already simplified the procedures of using the nukes. It is the calculation of the U.S. that it may hurl a large number of aggressor troops into the Korean front in a short span of time from the surrounding areas in case of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula and wage a war as it intends.
 A war on the peninsula will possibly spread to vast areas of Asia. 
 The U.S. is the chieftain of bringing the danger of thermo-nuclear war. With nothing the U.S. bellicose forces can cover up their criminal nature as the wrecker of peace on the Korean Peninsula and the ringleader of bringing the danger of a nuclear war.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Japan to Stop Running Wild
articles.content:
C.C. of 15th-Term South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Meets 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Central Committee of the 15th-term South Headquarters of the Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) was reportedly held in Seoul on March 25.
�@Its attendants heard a report on the 16th meeting of its co-chairmen and the 4th meeting of representatives of youth and student organizations of the north and the south and overseas for implementing the June 15 joint declaration held in March.
�@A resolution adopted at the meeting referred to the fact that the struggle for achieving independent reunification in the spirit of "By our nation itself" is now mounting on the Korean Peninsula. It condemned the United States for working hard to start a war and strain the situation in the peninsula quite contrary to this trend.
�@A struggle against the U.S. and the conservatives alone paves the way of successfully bringing earlier genuine independence, democracy and reunification, the resolution noted, appealing to the youth and students to take the lead in the struggle to frustrate the plot to perpetuate the presence of the U.S. forces in south Korea, stop the south Korea-U.S. war exercises and check the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek in a bid to foil the U.S. ambition to dominate the whole of the peninsula.
 The Presidium of the 15th-term South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon was elected and an action program for this year announced at the meeting.

articles.title: Chinese Minister of National Defence Arrives Here
Talks between DPRK and Chinese Defence Ministers
Moderate Earthquake Felt in Korea
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Chinese Defence Ministers 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here today between Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, member of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Col. General Cao Gangchuan, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, state councilor and minister of National Defense of the People's Republic of China.
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Kim Jong Gak, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and general officers and officers of the KPA and from the Chinese side Commander of the Shenyang Military Area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army Chang Wanquan, Assistant to the Chief of the General Staff of the CPLA Zhang Qinsheng, Deputy Commander of the Navy of the CPLA Zhang Yongyi, Deputy Political Commissar of the Air Force of the CPLA Liu Yazhou, Deputy Director of the General Office of the Central Military Commission Cao Yumin and other suite members, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and Military Attache of the Chinese embassy here Yang Xilian.
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and the two armies and issues of mutual concern.    
 The talks took place in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.content:
Moderate Earthquake Felt in Korea
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 4.1 on the Richter scale occurred in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at 18:14:1.2 on April 3.
 The epicenter of the quake is Taedong-ri area of latitude 38 degrees and 53 minutes N and longitude 126 degrees and 02 minutes E of Sangwon County, Pyongyang.
 The shock was felt by people within a 30-kilometer radius of the epicenter.
 There were five quakes of over 3 in the country this year. The Monday earthquake was observed as the biggest one.

articles.title: New Fodder Additive Developed
Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway Pays Off
articles.content:
New Fodder Additive Developed
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Researchers of an institute under the Ministry of Light Industry of the DPRK have made a new kind of fodder additive by processing asteroid by a microbiological method.
 They succeeded in making gruel-like multi amino acids which are sweetish, fragrant and saltless by applying a method of hydrolysis by enzyme in the intestines of asteroid.
 The gruel contains essential amino acids similar to those in beef and biological active materials like those in sea cucumber and insam (ginseng). Therefore it is very efficacious for increasing the body weight of domestic animals.

articles.title: Cuban Diplomats Visit Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway Pays Off
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- It is three years since the commissioning of the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong gravity-fed waterway of Korean style.
 It has provided at least 1.9 billion tons of water to more than ten towns, counties and districts in South Phyongan Province and Pyongyang. This is equal to the amount of water to be pumped by ten pumping machines with a capacity of 2 tons per second for three years non-stop.
 This waterway extending hundreds of kilometers from the Taegak Youth Dam runs to Lake Thaesong, filling 20 reservoirs with water and adding beauty to the  landscape of the country. It has watered fields of co-op farms realigned as befitting the land of socialist Korea, while supplying industrial and drinking water to inhabitants.
 The construction of this irrigation system resulted in saving more than 300 million kwh of electricity as it was no longer necessary to operate at least 500 pumps, electric motors, transformers at hundreds of pumping stations. It was more beneficial than operating a power station with a generating capacity of tens of thousands of kw.
 There appeared along the waterway such big and small power stations as the Taegak Youth Power Station and Phyongwon power stations Nos. 1, 2 and 3 and this also helped the existing minor power stations increase their capacity, creating an additional generating capacity of over 10,000 kw.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Cuban Diplomats Visit Korean Revolution Museum
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Ruben Perez Valdes and embassy members visited the Korean Revolution Museum Tuesday on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
 They went round historic relics and materials on display with keen interest. 
 At the end of the visit the ambassador wrote in a visitor's book that the Korean people would achieve greater success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Col. General Cao Gangchuan, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, state councilor and minister of National Defense of the People's Republic of China, on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed by Cao Gangchuan to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, member of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Tuesday.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of sympathy to Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
 As regards the recent quake that hit Iran, claiming many human and material losses, the message expressed deep condolences and sympathy to the Iranian president and, through him, to the  victims and their bereaved families and residents in the afflicted area and sincerely wished the Iranian government earliest possible recovery from the quake damage.
